Hello everybody,
        I am developing a project with NEAT that involves =
measuring an
elapsed time and using it as the fitness of the current organi=
sm. From
what I have seen in problems like pole balancing, the higher the
f=
itness the better the organism is, but in my case it is the opposite,
the l=
ower the time the better.

Can I just use the time this way (the lower the =
better) or should I
modify it so that a lower time yields a higher value fo=
r fitness, for
example 1/(elapsed_time) ?
I have tried checking the source =
code for NEAT but could not come up
with a solution for this.

Thank you fo=
r your help!
